markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Twilight Speaker Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=4114) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Gatewalkers</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #189: Dreamers of the Nameless Spires](/Sources.aspx?ID=195) pg. 78</row>

**Archetype** [Twilight Speaker](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=203)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)

</column>

---

You have carefully studied the histories, customs, and etiquette of many of the younger peoples of Golarion. You become an expert in Society. At 7th level, you become a master in Society, and at 15th level, you become legendary in Society. You can use the Society skill instead of the [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) skill when you attempt to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on a non-[elven](/Traits.aspx?ID=58) intelligent [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=91) creature.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the twilight speaker archetype.

<title level="2">Twilight Speaker Dedication leads to...</title>
[Betraying Shank](/Feats.aspx?ID=4117), [Disarming Smile](/Feats.aspx?ID=4116), [Empathetic Envoy](/Feats.aspx?ID=4115), [Ilverani Purist](/Feats.aspx?ID=4118), [World-Wise Vigilance](/Feats.aspx?ID=4119)
name: Twilight Speaker Dedication
